comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Thanks for these.  Sure to be useful.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: It is somewhat bizarre that this plan is labelled "Darling Harbour resumption plan",   seeing as how it is the area occupied by the south end tollgates of the Harbour Bridge  which isn't obviously directly involved with Darling Harbour,    it is on the east side of Kent Street on the top of the hill.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: The maps of the Darling Harbour and Port Jackson resumptions that were created in response to the Darling Harbour Wharves Resumption Act 1900 (Act No.10, 1900). As you can see the maps were titled at the time they were created. According to our records at the time the maps would have been the responsibility of the Roads and Bridges Branch [I] 1858- 1900 Roads Bridges and Public Watering Places Branch (1901- 1903). The current controlling Agency of the maps is Land and Property Management Authority. For a full description of the history of the maps please see Archives Investigator investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/Entity.aspx?Path=\Series\19348.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: A Digital Gallery showcasing these beautiful maps is on our website.
